thread.title: Holland wraps up dance competition; Broadway actors join...
thread.title_full: Holland wraps up dance competition; Broadway actors join... | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Sy O'Neill
title: Holland wraps up dance competition; Broadway actors join...
text:
Holland America Line’s “Dancing with the Stars”: at Sea program will have its final curtain call on the Champions Cruise Jan. 10.
Joining the cruise aboard ms Nieuw Amsterdam will be professional dancers and mirror ball trophy winners Tony Dovolani and Kym Johnson, along with celebrity personality Carson Kressley and actress Florence Henderson.
Sailing with the Stars takes place aboard Celebrity Reflection, sailing from PortMiami Nov. 5, 2016. (Contributed by Celebrity Cruises) Guests can watch the four perform routines from the ABC hit show as well as newly choreographed dances. Also offered: dance lessons with the ship’s professional team, a fashion show featuring costumes from the TV show, and a meet-and-greet with the stars.
The four stars also will join the “Dancing with the Stars”: at Sea theme cruise sailing Jan. 3.
WAITING IN THE WINGS: If you’re not dancing with the stars, you can still sail with them.
Celebrity Carson Kressley and professional dancer Kym Johnson will be aboard ms Nieuw Amsterdam on back-to-back seven-day cruises beginning Jan. 3 as part of the “Dancing with the Stars”: At Sea program. The Champions Cruise, which sails Jan. 10, will be the cruise line’s final collaboration with the TV show. (Contributed by Holland America Line) Broadway Theatre Cruises brings award-winning actors aboard Celebrity Reflection for Sailing with the Stars, Nov. 5-12, 2016. The ship departs from PortMiami, calling on Cozumel, Mexico; Grand Cayman Island; Falmouth, Jamaica; and Labadee, Haiti.
Special guests include Eden Espinosa, star of “Wicked” and “Rent”; Robert Cuciolli, star of “Spiderman,” “Jekyll & Hyde” and “Les Miserables”; Lee Roy Reams, star of “The Producers,” “42nd Street” and “Beauty and the Beast”; and Norb Joerder, director of “Camelot,” “42nd Street” and “La Cage Aux Folles.”
On the schedule: private and individual cabaret shows/concerts; opening and closing night cocktail parties; dinners with the stars; interviews and a Q&A session with the stars; Celebrity Idol — a musical competition;and a nightly piano bar.
The Impractical Jokers crew from truTV (from left) Salvatore “Sal” Vulcano, Joseph “Joe” Gatto, Brian “Q” Quinn and James “Murr” Murray will be sailing on Norwegian Pearl from Miami to Cozumel, Jan. 11-15. (Contributed) More information is available at www.broadwaytheatrecruises.com .
JUST SAY YES: Cruise to the Edge, the annual Yes fan cruise, has announced additions to the artist line-up: Mike Portnoy, Neal Morse Band and Haken.
Also planned: an all-star tribute and musical farewell to bassist and founding member of Yes, the late Chris Squire.
Lee Roy Reams, whose acting roles include “La Cage aux Folles,” will be aboard Sailing with the Stars, Nov. 5-12, 2016. (Photo by Amy Pasquantonio) The cruise, Nov. 15-19 aboard Norwegian Pearl, leaves from PortMiami and stops at Key West and the private island of Great Stirrup Cay. A pre-cruise party for guests will take place Nov. 14.
Progressive rock bands Yes and Marillion will lead an all-star lineup of 25-plus bands. Learn more at www.cruisetotheedge.com .
WIT ON THE WAVES: The stars of truTV’s “Impractical Jokers” will host a cruise aboard Norwegian Pearl Jan. 11-15, featuring comedians, musical performances and a generous dose of high jinks.
Alberto E. Rodriguez Actress Florence Henderson joins the “Dancing with the Stars”: At Sea program aboard Holland America’s Nieuw Amsterdam for cruises Jan. 3 and 10. (Photo by Alberto E. Rodriguez/Getty Images) Joe Gatto, James Murray, Brian Quinn and Sal Vulcano are The Tenderloins, a New York-based comedy troupe known for filming their public pranks for the TV show, now in its fourth season.
“Impractical Jokers” activities will include a lip sync battle; a Q&A session with the headliners; Hollywood Game Night; and Mystery Sciene Theater. Theme nights (with costumes) are in the planning stages.
The four-night cruise sails from PortMiami and calls on Cozumel. Details are at www.impracticaljokerscruise.com .
NAME THAT THEME: It seems as if there’s a theme cruise for just about everything these days, including astronomy and zombies.
Test your knowledge of theme cruises — and learn some surprising information along the way — at www.cruiseline.com.
Scroll down the home page to take the quiz. It’s not too hard to score 100 percent (I did!), which makes you a “Theme Cruise Expert.”
Most interesting: the sold-out Walker Stalker Cruise, Jan. 15 aboard Norwegian Pearl. Fans of “The Walking Dead” can still get on the waiting list for the three-day voyage.
